question: According to the ‘Lost at Home’ report published by the UNICEF, which country constituted the highest number of new internal displacements in the world in 2019?
explanation:
The United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) recently published a report titled ‘Lost at Home’. As per the report, India constituted the highest number of new internal displacements in the world in 2019, with more than 5 million.
India is followed by the Philippines, Bangladesh and China. As per the report, as many as 33 million new displacements were recorded in 2019. Out of the total displacements, around 25 million were because of natural disasters and 8.5 million were result of conflict and violence.
